data.description: Requisition ID: 92713 NextEra Energy Resources is one of America’s largest wholesale electricity generators, harnessing diverse energy sources to power progress. We deliver tailored energy solutions that fuel economic growth, strengthen communities, and help customers achieve their energy goals. Ready to make a lasting impact? Take the next step in your career with us! Position Specific Description Is creating a sustainable future important to you? NextEra Energy is using advanced grid planning techniques to develop the grid of tomorrow—come join our world-class team today! Position Specific Description The Energy Systems Analyst Intern for the Transmission Fundamentals Team will collaborate with other team members to design and build a unique software tool to look beyond the existing planning processes to identify and evaluate the transmission and generation needs of the future grid, and then design projects to meet those needs. This position is part of a team performing technical modeling and analysis to identify, evaluate, and support development of new opportunities on the transmission system. Our goal is to identify opportunities where others have not—and get them built! We highly value knowledge of grid planning and operations, developing novel analysis approaches or tools, and working with diverse geospatial and time-series data. Key Responsibilities Collaborate with colleagues to create new analysis tools and models to identify, design, and evaluate new transmission and generation projects Identify enhancements to state-of-the-art tools to better identify optimal transmission opportunities from the analysis of a multitude of scenarios and sensitivities Collaborate with internal and external Subject Matter Experts to arrive at the most cost-effective and competitive transmission solutions Preferred Qualifications Power systems knowledge Experience in data analysis and modeling Experience with power flow or production cost modeling software Knowledge of transmission and renewable energy generation Familiarity with Python Job Overview To be considered for an internship, you must be actively enrolled at a college or university as a full-time student seeking a bachelor’s degree or higher. You must also have a current cumulative GPA of 3.00 or higher (on a 0.00 to 4.00 scale). Job Duties & Responsibilities Assists department with assigned projects Completes challenging projects and assignments Presents final project to senior leadership at the end of the internship Assumes responsibility for own travel, lodging, and transportation necessary to be available for the program Performs other job-related duties as assigned Required Qualifications High school grad / GED Maintain active enrollment in a Bachelor or higher degree program Maintain cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher Preferred Qualifications None The base pay range for this position is $14.62 to $21.92 per hour. This range represents the expected base pay for a successful candidate and is based on a variety of factors, including skills, experience, and internal equity. Employee Group: Non ExemptEmployee Type: InternJob Category: InternOrganization: NextEra Energy Project Management, LLC Relocation Provided: No This position is eligible for Company sponsored benefits. Click here to see our benefits. In order to apply to this position, please visit jobs.nexteraenergy.com or follow the instructions for the job site on which this appears. Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, age, national origin, religion, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetics, disability, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by law.
